entry.summary: ...ANOTHER ROUND OF SNOW AND POTENTIAL MIXED PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST TODAY AND MONDAY... An active pattern will continue over the Southwest as another strong pressure system moves north into the Kuskokwim Delta and Bristol Bay later today into Monday. A mix of rain, snow and potentially a short period of freezing rain and sleet will

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 2:26PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... The long tap of Pacific moisture streaming northeastward up from Hawaii, which is often described as an atmospheric river, will continue to shift slowly southward across the central and southern Alaskan Panhandle tonight. This will result in periods of moderate to sometimes heavy rainfall through Sunday morning before diminishing.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels
